filmography.title: Up in Arms
filmography.role_description: A hypochondriac elevator operator who gets drafted into the army and causes chaos.
filmography.plot: A hypochondriac is drafted into the US Army and smuggles his girlfriend onto the transport ship.

filmography.title: Wonder Man
filmography.role_description: A dual role playing a studious bookworm and his murdered twin brother, a flashy nightclub entertainer who returns as a ghost.
filmography.plot: A bookworm must impersonate his murdered twin brother to help bring the killers to justice, guided by the brother's ghost.

filmography.title: The Kid from Brooklyn
filmography.role_description: A timid milkman who accidentally knocks out a champion boxer and is turned into a prizefighter.
filmography.plot: A milkman becomes a boxing sensation through a series of fixed fights, believing he is a true contender.

filmography.title: The Secret Life of Walter Mitty
filmography.role_description: A meek magazine proofreader who escapes his domineering mother through vivid daydreams of heroism.
filmography.plot: A clumsy dreamer gets caught up in a real-life conspiracy involving crown jewels while retreating into his fantasy world.

filmography.title: A Song Is Born
filmography.role_description: A shy music professor documenting the history of music who discovers the world of jazz.
filmography.plot: A group of music professors researching the history of music get involved with a nightclub singer on the run from the mob.

filmography.title: The Inspector General
filmography.role_description: An illiterate medicine show stooge who is mistaken for a feared government inspector by corrupt town officials.
filmography.plot: A wandering fool is mistaken for the Inspector General in a corrupt village, where officials try to bribe and assassinate him.

filmography.title: On the Riviera
filmography.role_description: A dual role as an American entertainer and a French industrialist whom he impersonates.
filmography.plot: An American cabaret artist mimics a pilot so successfully that he is hired to impersonate him, confusing the pilot's wife.

filmography.title: Hans Christian Andersen
filmography.role_description: A fictionalized version of the Danish storyteller who spins tales for children while falling for a ballerina.
filmography.plot: A cobbler in a small village loves to tell stories to children but leaves for Copenhagen to seek his fortune.

filmography.title: Knock on Wood
filmography.role_description: A ventriloquist who unknowingly carries stolen blueprints inside his dummy, attracting spies.
filmography.plot: A ventriloquist becomes the target of a spy ring after secret plans are hidden in his dummy.

filmography.title: White Christmas
filmography.role_description: A song-and-dance man who teams up with his war buddy (Bing Crosby) to save their general's failing inn.
filmography.plot: A successful song-and-dance team become romantically involved with a sister act and team up to save the failing inn of their former commanding general.

filmography.title: Assignment Children
filmography.role_description: A documentary short featuring Kaye's work as a UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador; led to his Honorary Oscar.
filmography.plot: Danny Kaye travels the world as an ambassador for UNICEF, documenting the organization's work with children.

filmography.title: The Court Jester
filmography.role_description: A carnival entertainer who masquerades as the court jester to help restore the rightful king to the throne.
filmography.plot: A hapless carnival performer masquerades as the court jester as part of a plot against an evil ruler who has overthrown the rightful king.

filmography.title: Merry Andrew
filmography.role_description: An unconventional British teacher who joins a traveling circus to dig for a Roman statue.
filmography.plot: A teacher at a British boys' school digs for a Roman statue on the site of a traveling circus and falls for the ringmaster's daughter.

filmography.title: Me and the Colonel
filmography.role_description: A resourceful Jewish refugee who must travel with an anti-Semitic Polish colonel to escape the Nazis.
filmography.plot: During WWII, a Jewish refugee and an anti-Semitic Polish colonel are forced to flee Paris together.

filmography.title: The Five Pennies
filmography.role_description: The jazz cornet player and bandleader whose career is interrupted by his daughter's battle with polio.
filmography.plot: A biography of jazz musician Red Nichols, focusing on his music and his daughter's illness.

filmography.title: On the Double
filmography.role_description: An American soldier with a talent for mimicry who is ordered to impersonate a British general.
filmography.plot: A GI who is a dead ringer for a British General is asked to impersonate him to confuse the Germans.

filmography.title: The Man from the Diners' Club
filmography.role_description: A timid credit card clerk who accidentally issues a card to a gangster and tries to retrieve it.
filmography.plot: An employee at Diners' Club issues a credit card to a well-known mobster and has to retrieve it in order to keep his job.

filmography.title: The Madwoman of Chaillot
filmography.role_description: A philosophical ragpicker who participates in a mock trial held by the Countess to judge the wicked.
filmography.plot: A countess uncovers a plot to drill for oil in Paris and sets up a trial to judge the conspirators.

filmography.title: Peter Pan
filmography.role_description: The villainous pirate captain and the stern father in this musical TV movie adaptation.
filmography.plot: A musical retelling of the Peter Pan story, featuring songs by Anthony Newley and Leslie Bricusse.

filmography.title: Pinocchio
filmography.role_description: The woodcarver who creates Pinocchio, played with warmth in this musical TV movie.
filmography.plot: A musical version of the story of the puppet who wants to be a real boy.

filmography.title: Skokie
filmography.role_description: A Holocaust survivor who leads his community's opposition to a planned Neo-Nazi march in their town.
filmography.plot: Based on a true story, a Jewish community attempts to stop a Neo-Nazi group from marching in their town.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor (Miniseries/TV Film)

filmography.title: Dime a Dance
filmography.role_description: A sailor who tries to romance a dance hall girl; one of Kaye's early Educational Pictures shorts.
filmography.plot: A dance hall girl tries to find romance while dealing with various partners.

filmography.title: Getting an Eyeful
filmography.role_description: A comedic Russian character in a short film, showcasing his early talent for dialects.
filmography.plot: A man tries to help his friend get glasses so he can pass a physical.

filmography.title: Cupid Takes a Holiday
filmography.role_description: Kaye reprises his Russian character in this short comedy about a matchmaker.
filmography.plot: A matchmaker tries to find a wife for a difficult client.

filmography.title: Money on Your Life
filmography.role_description: A man targeted by assassins who is protected by an insurance salesman trying to save his policy.
filmography.plot: A man buys a life insurance policy, unaware that he is a target for murder.
